data.title: So very tasty
data.text: We love everything here. Great food. Fresh and tasty. Shwarma, gyro, salads, juju sauce, the pickled turnip or radish they need to bottle and sell those things they are addictive.

data.title: Little Gem of Madera
data.text: I have frequented this place many times and the sister restaurants located in Clovis Ca., known as Tofa's. They now have the same menu as Tofa's of Clovis and this is a very nice improvement from the old menu. You gotta stop in and try each dish, you will be another satisfied foodie!

data.title: Something different
data.text: Certainly not your typical menu of burgers and fries. The food tasted fresh and was seasoned just right. The flavors were excellent and I needed a fork to finish the gyro because it was so packed full.

data.title: Delicious hummus!
data.text: We walked here from our hotel so it was convenient. We were happy with our order. The hummus was really good and we enjoyed dipping the fresh pita bread in it.

data.title: A welcome delicious departure from normal horrible business travel food
data.text: The food here is fantastic.  Not a fancy place - casual interior.  But the food is amazing.  The hummus is outstanding.  Get a side order -- you won't be sorry!  The chicken kebab was wonderfully spiced and perfectly cooked - grilled veggies were excellent - even the rice was great and I usually skip the rice!  My colleague had the kafta -- spices were excellent but it was a little dry.  (although when you add the hummus, it was heavenly!)  I ate the entire plate and actually licked some of the hummus off at the end!  What a wonderful thing to be able to find a healthy restaurant while on a business trip!  I will be back!

data.title: Good food
data.text: Food is always tasty. They are always busy at lunch. Best salads in Madera. Great for a quick lunch if you order in advance.

data.title: Very Good
data.text: This is the first time eating there and I unfortunately couldn't figure out what I wanted. In saying this I asked the waitress and she suggested a meal. I was pleasantly surprised for it was good.

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: The restaurant was very clean, the staff was fast and friendly, and the food was very tasty.  I had a chicken plate.  The veggies were good and the bread was fresh!

data.title: Great food Great service
data.text: This is so good. Every dish we have tried has been great. Love the garlic juju sauce. Fresh food, friendly service. Chicken schwarma is one of my favorites. This place is a must for Madera.

data.title: Decent food, poor service, inconsistent
data.text: While the food quality was okay, the server seemed annoyed when I asked what a couple of words on the menu meant since I had never been there before, which was irritating. You pick up your food when it is ready and my clients and I all got salads. One of the ladies got some kind of cheese spread for her pita, another got garlic butter for hers and two of us got nothing. I found that very odd...? Why would I want a plain pita bread? It was "eh" and I wouldn't go there again. All in all I found Madera to have HORRIBLE restaurant options so I ate dinner at the same place every night since it was the only decent place in town and it was NOT Kabab Grill.

data.title: Love it!
data.text:
This place is still a hidden gem.  I still get asked "where is that?"

The food is fresh and full of flavor.  I love their humus!

Sometimes the wait is a bit long, but I still enjoy it.

You order and pick up at the counter; very laid back.

data.title: Surprisingly good
data.text: It's in Madera (a town not known for a Mediterranean population), and it's in a little corner strip mall, but this place is as good a place as any! Their sandwiches are very good, but I really like the variety of their plates. The chicken and shiskabab are very good. The pilaf is also very good. The stand-out? Their Hummus! It's amazing! I'm also somewhat addicted to the juju garlic sauce. The decor is contemporary and cool, making the vintage Pop Lavaal photos stand out to be admired. Staff are good. This is a lunch counter type place but casual dining isn't bad. It's definitely something different!

data.title: Good mediterranean food
data.text: I have frequented this restaurant both for lunch and dinner. The food is good and plentiful. This restaurant truly stands out in comparison to the other eateries in the neighborhood. Very refreshing and delicious change. The place is clean and fresh in appearance. Service is relatively quick, especially for cooked food. Cost is reasonable. The walls are covered with historic central valley photographs by Pop Laval. Surprisingly, they offer a drive- thru!. Great for those of us with 30 minute lunches. Their menu include Gyros, Kebabs, Salads, Shwarmas, rice pilaf, hummus, salads, etc. Take the time to try this restaurant. I am sure you will find it delightful.

data.title: My favorite place to eat in Madera
data.text: if you're around the courthouse/county admin/library area, there's no better place to eat lunch. Good, wholesome food, quick service, friendly staff. Being vegetarian, my choice almost invariably falls on their veggie platter, which I really love.

data.title: like a middle eastern/mediterranean 'subway'
data.text: we had been hoping for a more authentic place but discovered this was a chain-type restaurant. nice menu options and everything seemed fairly fresh. a bit expensive, but good tasting. nice options, but definitely a conveyor belt restaurant. cant call it 'very good' but would give it a 3.5 as it is def better than average.

data.title: Wow! Surprisingly good!
data.text:
Found this place by accident. I've driven the 16 miles to eat there several times! (Don't tell my wife) 
Very authentic Med food at a reasonable price. 
The employees are always friendly and personable. 
This is the only place where I will eat the hummus. I don't care for it normally due to it's normally grainy texture. It's a texture thing for me. 
Here, the hummus is like velvet! 
And the garlic sauce I always order an extra and slather it on everything. The Kafta(?) mixed lamb and beef plate is my favorite. 
They opened a new location in Clovis, Ca called Tofus, this location will change name to Tofus as well eventually. 
The Clovis location is not as good but I hope it spools up with time. It will be a much shorter drive.
>>>>>Oh, the parking lot is near non-existent and at lunch, it's PACKED. So you've been warned. Go early like at 11,or after 2. 
Parking is very bad so you'll walk a bit but not the end of the world.<<<<

data.title: Our Regular Pit Stop
data.text: Love the selection, the taste, the atmosphere, and the location. Madera has a few good places to eat, but this is our first choice. The price is reasonable for the quality of food served. A must place to eat when you are in Madera!

data.title: Nicely average
data.text: The food was average. The place was very nice. The tzatziki sauce was good with fresh dill. The bread for the sandwiches was too dry with too much greens.

data.title: Nice surprise
data.text: Very nice decor and service.  Great selection and reasonable prices on tasty food.  We had sharmas and gyros and we were not disappointed.

data.title: An Unexpected Surprise in Madera.
data.text:
Traveling north on hwy. 99 and seen a sign with this restaurant advertised. So, needing fuel also, decided to look for it and glad I did. The food is prepared fresh, tasty and with various sauces you can add. I chose the "kebab" combo and it didn't look like much, but it was very filling and would order again. Also, my friend had the  "sharhma" wrap; not sure if that is the correct spelling, but it is this large serving and is pictured behind the counter. The dressing or sauce is much like a "ranch".
Great place, will repeat if in the area!
